data: Ordering of tocilizumab or baricitinib is restricted to Critical Care physicians OR COVID-19 Unit Internists OR Infectious Diseases physicians per site restrictions
Patients admitted to hospital for more than 14 days with symptoms of COVID-19 should NOT receive tocilizumab or baricitinib for COVID-19

Inclusion criteria
tocilizumab or baricitinib should be administered within 24 hours of initiation of life support due to confirmed COVID-19, including:
- high-flow oxygen support (e.g., Optiflow) with flow rate greater than 30 L/min and FiO2 greater than 0.4
OR
- invasive or non-invasive mechanical ventilation 
OR
- vasopressor or inotropic support

Exclusion Criteria - Do NOT use tocilizumab if:
- ANC is less than 1 x 10^9/L
- Platelets are less than 50 x 10^9/L
- ALT or AST is greater than 5 times the upper normal limit
- Active serious infection other than COVID-19
- Known condition or treatment resulting in ongoing immune suppression including neutropenia prior to hospitalization
- Receipt of one or more doses of interferon, anakinra, tocilizumab, or sarilumab during this hospitalization or on longterm therapy
650 mg, PO, as directed, order duration: 1 doses or times, drug form: tab
50 mg, PO, as directed, order duration: 1 doses or times, drug form: cap
50 mg, IV, as directed, order duration: 1 doses or times, drug form: inj
400 mg, IV once, drug form: inj
If tocilizumab is not available, order baricitinib. Baricitinib should be continued for 14 days or until hospital discharge, whichever is sooner
4 mg, PO, qdaily, order duration: 14 day
4 mg, NG-tube, qdail, order duration: 14 day
For patients with GFR 30 to 59 mL/min
2 mg, PO, qdaily, order duration: 14 day
2 mg, NG-tube, qdaily, order duration: 14 dya
For patients with GFR 15 to 29 mL/min
2 mg, PO, q2day, order duration: 14 day
2 mg, NG-tube, q2day, order duration: 14 day
